subject: Management
title: The Generalist Advantage
description: A quick win: understand The Generalist Advantage.

hook.text: NASA's best problem solvers weren't specialists. They were engineers who had worked across many domains.

buildup.text: Specialists go deep. Generalists connect dots across boundaries. Teams need both.

discovery.text: David Epstein's research: generalists excel in complex environments where problems cross disciplines.

twist.text: Most hiring favors specialists. But the person who bridges two fields often creates the breakthrough.

climax.text: Include at least one generalist: someone who speaks multiple technical languages.

punchline.text: Specialists find depth. Generalists find connections. You need both.

quiz.question: When are generalists most valuable on a team?
options: In complex environments where problems cross multiple disciplines
When the team only works on one narrow technical problem
Only in early-stage startups without defined roles
